content.question: The particle diagram above shows the system represented by the equation <math alttext="2 X gas plus Y 2 gas is in equilibrium with 2 X Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>X(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>XY(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following explains whether the particle diagram indicates that the system is at equilibrium?

choices.label: The particle diagram does not indicate that the system is at equilibrium because it shows the system only at one point in time.

The particle diagram does not indicate that the system is at equilibrium because the ratio <math alttext="the fraction the equilibrium molar concentration of X Y over the equilibrium molar concentration of X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[XY</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[X</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is not equal to 1.
The particle diagram indicates that the system is at equilibrium because the value of <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is small.

The particle diagram indicates that the system is at equilibrium because <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of X equals 2 times the equilibrium molar concentration of Y 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[X]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The particle diagram does not indicate that the system is at equilibrium because it shows the system only at one point in time.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
